item.description:
Hi Everyone,
My daughter's 9 year old friend is battling brain cancer--I cannot imagine what she and her parents are going through. All of us know someone who has suffered and possibly died from cancer, but it is especially agonizing to know a child who has to endure this.

Therefore, this meetup idea is a special one, in my opinion.

If you have lots of crayons and crayon pieces at home, and don't know what to do with them, you'll really love this:

Little Y Kids are Reaching Out
March 11 3:30pm-5:30pm (come anytime within those hours, stay as little or as long as you'd like--no shopping required)

Children ages 3-9 can come help peel, sort, and break crayons for melting. These crayons will then be melted down and transformed into a variety of shapes! Assorted "transformed crayons" are sold for a donation of $1 (or more, whatever one wants to give).

All proceeds from the "transformed crayons" will be donated to "Crayons for Cancer", an organization raising funds for KIDS currently battling cancer.

Crayons for Cancer is organized right here in Manchester, CT! It originally started here because of a little boy named Tarsh Brown, who would have been a student at Bowers Elementary School, but he died before his 4th birthday.

Proceeds from this event go directly to the Connecticut Children's Medical Center's Family Fund, which helps parents with parking and meals to ease the debilitating costs of cancer treatments.

More info on this organization can be found at http://www.crayonsfor...
item.how_to_find_us: Go to the Little Y Kids Club near the register lines at the front of the store.

group.name: The Greater Hartford Area Parents Meetup Group

item.name: Crayons for Cancer at Big Y's "Little Y Kids Club"
